Irvine is a great professor and person who you can tell genuinely cares about his students. Very accessible out of class and wants to help. However, the class is a solid 2 hours of reading 3 times a week, and exams are difficult. Generous curve at end of class

The only thing good about Irvine is his personality. Amazing guy, extremely funny, and very knowledgeable. However, DO NOT take for law. This was by far the hardest class I have ever taken and the most work I've done than all of my other classes combined. He's a great person, but not worth 2+ hours of reading 3x a week and insanely hard exams.

great guy who makes the class fairly interesting. will definitely hold your attention, but cold calls for pretty much every question in class. 20 pages of dense reading roughly every two days. Def easier profs you could take

Prof Irvine is amazing at what he does. He's by far one of the most passionate professors I have ever taken, and the only professor that woke you up at 8am- for a law class. He is by far one of the best professors at Fisher. However, the class is notoriously difficult- tons of reading and cold calls, with little to 0 grades. Pray for a curve.

There are def easier professors you could take. But Irvine is the best. He's so funny, makes you WANT to learn the material and makes you work for this. Make sure you read every night. He likes to call on people and you better know the answer. If you sit in the front row, he calls on you less. The exams are more application based so know your stuff

Prof Irvine really knows Law well and enjoys teaching it. He gives very engaging lectures so BE PREPARED when he calls on you. Attendance is mandatory (graded) but worth it since you learn a lot and he's also hilarious! READ the chapters/handouts, TAKE NOTES, and GO TO CLASS. The class isn't easy but I learned so much and enjoyed every meeting. 5/5

Don't take him early in the day, and definitely don't sit front row or he'll call on you nonstop. Readings every class and 50-100 questions on midterm and final. Way too much work for 1.5 credits. Pop quizzes as well. Heavy reading. Heavy lecture. Must show up to class for participation.

Irvine is a great guy and makes the criteria interesting. However, he goes SO fast and calls on you at random in class. It's hard to keep up. Graded on attendance and participation. Exams are fairly difficult; put in work and you can pull of a B on them. Don't be afraid to ask questions because when he passes it, he won't go back.

Irvine is very passionate about law, which is what made his class fun and interesting. However, it is a lot of work. You have to read each chapter and takes notes so that you can answer any question he throws at you during class. He is super energetic in class and expects a lot out of everyone. His exams are also decently challenging as well.

Professor Irvine is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He makes the potentially boring subject of law interesting. Make sure to do all of the readings, though, because class participation is a must if you want a good grade. The exams are a little tough, but as long as you keep up on the readings and engage with him in class, you'll do ok

This is my second time taking professor Irvine and I enjoyed it just as much as the first. Law is a pretty dry subject but Irvine does a great job livening it up. If participation is low or people do not know the material, he will have pop quizzes so read the chapters. Exams are tough but fair if you study appropriately

Had Irvine for 3500 my freshman year and enjoyed his class so much I decided to take 4510 as a finance elective my senior year. Same format as 3500, 7 weeks with a whole lot of reading and participation required. Favorite classes and professor by far at OSU, really cares that you learn the material and does it in a fun way. Highly recommended!!!

Very smart man; extremely knowledgable about his subject. Makes law somewhat interesting. Lots of reading and he cold calls you in class. Exams are very tough (the final was 81 questions in 80 minutes) but he gives a fair curve. If you do the readings and show up to class you will do decent.

Exams are horrendous. 81 questions in 80 minutes and each question is based off of a wordy text prompt. Confusing, he labels three participants in a problem Jack Jill and Joe. Unnecessarily hard and he tries to make you fail those exams.

Irvine is an extremely engaging and intelligent professor. The midterm & final together make up over 75% of your grade so make sure you read all the textbook sections, take diligent notes, and go through his power points. Always read because when he calls on students if 3 people answer incorrectly there is a pop quiz. Challenging but learned a lot

Truly an awesome professor. He is certainly knows the material like no other. Its a 7 weeks course so you have to read, read, read, it is a must in order to pass. He has pop quizzes and grades for attendance/participation so it is important to be at class. Midterm and Final can be tricky if you do not study, take notes while reading. He curves well

Professor Irvine makes a pretty dry class worth going to.  He is an extremely funny guy and his lectures are awesome. There is unfortunately a ton of reading, and he randomly calls on people to make sure everyone is keeping up. He makes pop quizzes if the class is not prepared on any given day. Exams are pretty tough but theres a pretty nice curve

INTENSE but very good at what he does. Walks around classroom to engage and has no shame is calling anyone out. KEEP UP WITH THE READINGS or you will get behind fast. Exams are challenging but hey, that's law for you.

Professor Irvine is hilarious! One of the best lecturers I've ever had. Definitely makes going to class pretty enjoyable. BUT, by far one of the harder classes I've ever taken. The reading never stops, exams are extremely difficult, and there are pop quizzes. He expects you to read EVERY piece of text on whatever is assigned (book, article, etc.)

What makes this class difficult is the amount of material covered (20 chapters), not the material itself. Read for thorough understanding before every class and make sure to participate. This was not an easy class by any stretch, but Prof Irvine makes it enjoyable. You should have fun during class. Prof. Irvine is the best professor at Fisher. I had him for 3500 and enjoyed the class so much I took 4510 as an elective (Finance). This is how college is supposed to be taught.

Dr. Irvine is one of the best and most meaningful professors within Fisher. All of his lectures were engaging (since he calls on people randomly, which forces you to pay attention). The class is definitely hard though, and there are substantial readings every night. Exams have huge weight.

Very intelligent, funny professor. He blasts music before class. Make SURE you do the reading, he will randomly call on people and gives pop quizzes. Offers case studies for EC. Calls on you randomly and knowing the answer is a smal part of your grade so it makes class very stressful. Make sure you have read the chapter for class always and know the material. Irvine was by far the most student friendly teacher I have had here at OSU. He is extremely knowledgable, very nice, funny and is a great teacher. Yes, you have to read a lot because he will randomly call on students but he makes the class very interesting.
Irvine is the best professor I've ever had. You won't regret four years of collage after taking his class! Lectures are amazing and what he teaches is very useful in daily life.

Irvine is a great teacher overall. He is hilarious in class to help keep you engaged, makes law somewhat fun! Class was a lot of fun.  He always blasts music before and after class, and his lectures are extremely engaging.  He WILL call on you at random, so make sure you've read the material.  Exams aren't easy, but if you've put time into reading the book well and taking good notes, you should do fine.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TAKING DETAILED NOTES.

Best Professor I've ever had.  Guy is a Dude! Hilarious. Phenomenal Teaching Style. Lectures fly by because he keeps you so engaged. Plays music before class and gets you HYPED for Law. Irvine is the man. Makes lectures interesting and fun. I can honestly say I enjoyed going to class. Get ready to read though

Irvine is great. The class isn't easy, but it could be if you put the work i and really try to learn the information. I feel like I have taken a great deal from this course and he is my favorite professor so far at Fisher. He is hilarious and truly cares about his students. Absolutely recommend.
GREAT-Must take him

Irvine is a great teacher and is very passionate about law. You must read the book and be prepared for class because he WILL call on you to answer questions. HE's a really good dude. Makes Business Law, a normally boring topic, interesting and fun. You have to keep up on reading because he calls on students at random, but I don't think anyone minded because his lectures were so engaging.

Great class! Basically the same format as 3500. Far class. Like everyone is saying, an amazing teacher that makes law very interesting. I feel like I can truly apply the information learned to everyday life.

Law made into a fun class! Yes it exists! Challenging during lecture, but exams are fair! Take him!

This was the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He is clear about the information that is important, which makes the tests easier. Irvine is the best professor I've had in Fisher.  He makes class interesting, which is good, because it's mandatory.  He expects you to read ahead of class and will give quizzes if there aren't enough people or people aren't prepared.  Definitely take him! Not too difficult of a class either

He is a nice teacher. He makes the subject interesting, and he cares about it.  He makes it mandatory that you must read for every class; bring your book to class. He makes the class applicable to life. Exams are challenging.

not a nice person and really hard with grading, avoid him if you can

By far one of the best professors i have ever had. he really cares about all his students and wants them all to do well. the class is hard, but he very fair. he expects you to read before class and be ready. he made this class enjoyable and he is pretty funny. i hope i get to take him again. great teacher, take him if you can

Worst grade I've ever received at fisher (C-!)... I think I bombed the final, anyway I'm not going to let my grade reflect my rating like most people do... Awesome teacher by far

Best teacher I've had in Fisher. Very entertaining/funny. Read the book before class and review the chapters again before tests and you will do fine. Be on time, be prepared, and pay attention!

Great teacher. Make sure you keep up in class, I think that there's a fair curve at the end, which is nice. It kind of seems like a lot of your grade is up in the air, but as long as you read and understand the book you'll be fine.

One of the better professors that I had at Fisher. By far my favorite teacher in college. Extremely fun to banter with and incredibly intelligent. Wish I could take it again, it was that good! The class moved back to 10:30, which makes it a great time of day too! Always in good spirits, keep up with the book and you'll love this class/professor!

this guy is honestly the best teacher i have ever had. He keeps everybody entertained and interested in class. awesome guy, very helpful and makes class fun to go to. exams we hard and he is the only teacher for this class who requires homework every class (even tho he most likely doesnt ever look at them) lecture can be confusing because he just talks and doesnt write anything down. you will earn more with him that blackburn or weinstock.
Awesome. Wish he thought accounting too.
I cannot stress this enough. Best teacher i have ever had! The class was extremely interesting and not hard at all. Do NOT take this class with any other teacher!

nice guy, funny... if you have it at 8:30am it tends to get old after a while.  lots and lots of questions, tricky ones, on the exams.  80 midterm 100 final.  read the book and be prepared.  do the extra credit cases.

Best teacher Ive had in college.  He's funny, knows the material very well, and conveys it in an a way that is easy to understand.  Must be prepared for class as he calls on everyone, but he seemed to get everyone more motivated than any teacher Ive had. You have to take him if you get the chance.

By far my favorite instructor in my four years at OSU...he is hilarious, incredibly smart and makes the class tons of fun.  I learned more in those 10 weeks then most of my other courses combined.  Highly recommend!!

Fantastic! is really funny and fair, makes you learn, only drawback is the class was at 8:30 AM with a 7:30 final, still, HIGHLY recommended

Very Good Professor.  Tough yet Fair.  He on your toes bc he will know who you are and he knows when you are BSing an answer.  I would recommend his class if you want to learn something and be amused.  Be ready to work hard in that class though
Best teacher in fisher.  Be prepared, be attentive, be on time, and you'll get an A.
HE is just gr8. you will luv his class. he is funny and a good teacher.i highly recommend him for 510.
Excellent teacher.  Cream of the crop.  Highly reccomend.
great teacher...very entertaining.  calls on everyone and learns everyone's name.

He is very cool beans



































































And also my uncle

An amazing fun professor who loves to teach and is very knowledgable. Class was easy, the way he teaches the class is by talking with the class the entire time. Dan is a good guy as long as you don't believe a word he says. He's got this impressive smokescreen but when you peel back the onion, that whats you have. A stinky onion making you cry. The class is easy until the last two weeks.  The  class is basically run by the TA.  Oglevee was NEVER available, the TA was an idiot. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
I love his class! You can expect to learn a lot from him. The class material was not dry, and it was more like a MBA form. This is the class that worth you paying for the tuition.

This is a required class for finance major. And it is way too much. Not difficult or anything. Just we need to build excel sheet all over. kind of remind me of CS&E tho. His instruction was very unclear, especially at the beginning, we were so lost.
Hands down the best professor I have had, grad or undergrad.

Oglevee is a great guy but certainly one of the most difficult classes you can take. I would say finance students have a distinct advantage in his class over entrepreneur students since there is alot of fin modeling. Good life lessons and good professor but just very hard

Oglevee is awesome. His style of teaching isn't for everyone, but its definitely a unique approach. The thing I like about the class is that I felt the work I put into it reflected my grade, which I can't really say for any other Fisher class. Anyways, don't ask too many questions about the class; its an adventure and knowing 2 much would spoil it.

Professor Oglevee has extensive experience in the business world. He has worked on Wall Street and been an entrepreneur. He spends at least 20 minutes of each class session telling stories (which are very enriching) and giving tips on succeeding in business. He has high expectations but you will learn more as a result. Fantastic class.
590 is an amazing class. It is demanding but it was the most rewarding class of my 6 years at OSU. Dan challenges you to analyze you point of view and pushes you to defend it.
Great professor who is genuinely interested in the topic and helping students learn.  Focuses on real-world skills and teaches in a very hands-on way.
Very Nice Guy.  Very Helpful.

"My way or the high way" style.Zero tolerance on tardiness.Has unique grading system which he will not explain how it works. Lectures basicly gave tons of information and to see what you think of it.You have to be talent or expereinced or extremely passionate to succeed.
I actually really liked his class. Best Class I took at Fisher.  Real experience is shared with students.  Talks about real issues in the business world including social issues.  Good class.
learned incredible skills with him. Honest, direct and sharp.
Team teaches with Bill Rives, but in my mind is the better of the two professors. He can be a little rough around the edges at first, but is entertaining and extremely helpful once he's lightened up.
Best Professor for a business major. You'll learn a lot in any of his classes.
He is great!
Outstanding professor - His Bus-fin 494 course was the best class that I have taken at OSU.

Prof. Oglevee is BY FAR the best teacher on this campus! He knows more about the financial world because he has been there. He has great insight not only into the realm of finance but also how to succeed in business life. If you do nothing else at OSU you must take 590 with him! He cares about his students and is so interesting outside of class!!

Prof Oglevee is BY FAR the best teacher I have ever had at OSU. He gives so much insight to useful real world experience for business majors. His class is the only class I enjoyed attending in college. If I had one piece of advice for anyoone pursuing a career in the future, it would be to meet this man!!
Uses obscure multiple choice questions on quizzes and tests. You must read the text before attending class. Overall very helpful and sometimes entertaining.
Oglevee is one of the most refined business professors I have ever had. I strongly recommend taking his Derivatives class. He brings a wealth of real world information to class.
hard class but well worth the effort;good guy
He was a great professor who shared real life experience with us.  He cared about his students and explained the subject matter very thoroughly. I would take him for another Finance class

He tries to be a good teacher, however he wastes too much time telling personal stories.The tests are confusing, and meant to see how well you read the textbook. Oglevee does nothing more than read off a powerpoint that we already have, so he's worthless

Always calls on the same 5 people in class.  Does not give anyone else a chance to speak.  This was supposed to be a corporate finance class, and all he talks about is how much money he has lost in his ventures.  Would probably be a good start-up teacher.
TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM!  Great teacher, has real world experience, cares about students, learns names, small classes, interesting subject.  Highly recommend.
100% best Fisher professor. Such a caring professor, super willing to look out for his student's best interests. Big big fan of Michael Wittry. Corporate Finance with him is an absolute must.

Great professor, lectures aren't boring, he really cares about watching his students succeed. I wish he taught more undergrad classes. His tests are kind of hard, but if you apply yourself, it's not too bad. 100% recommend taking Corp Fin with him.

Wittry is awesome. Funny dude, super chill and understanding. In-class time is used to go over practice problems and conceptual topics. The class isn't that hard, study an hour or two before each quiz and you'll be more than fine. Would 100% take this class with him again
Great professor. Wittry is very passionate about teaching and about his students and I cannot recommend him enough.

Professor Wittry is the best professor I have ever had. He combines being passionate and knowledgeable with just being a great person. Lectures are almost always enjoyable, and he often brings real-world content into the classroom. Take Wittry for Corporate Finance.

Probably the best professor I've had while at Ohio State. He's such a great teacher, but also a great person overall. His lectures are very insightful, and to the point, and his classes are not boring. I will miss his class!

Professor Wittry is an amazing professor. He cares a lot about his students and is very knowledgeable in finance. He makes sure everyone understands the content and makes himself even more available for those who need extra help. Compared to what I have heard about others who teach this course, I recommend taking it with him.

Corporate finance can be a dry subject but Professor Wittry both taught it well and tried to apply it to real-world events which made the material easier to digest. Not an easy A but not a crazy workload or anything, and Professor Wittry goes out of his way to help his students.

Professor Wittry was definitely one of my favorite professors. You can tell he really cares for his student's success and tries really hard to make sure you understand the material. The course consisted of bi-weekly quizzes, a group presentation, a midterm and a final. I wasn't a huge fan of the course, but the professor was just purely amazing.

There was a quiz almost every week that wasnt too bad. There was a simulation that you had to do with a group, then with the same group we presented a current event. The midterm was fine the final was difficult, but he gave a practice final that was about the same as the actual final so that was nice. Read your textbook and dont fall behind.

Professor Wittry easily became one of my favorite professors at Fisher. His ability to deliver material in a way that is understandable is what sets him apart from all other professors. He definitely cares about all of us succeeding and is always available after and outside of class. Weekly quizzes were very beneficial I wish he taught more courses

Best teacher I've had in Fisher! Mike is one of those professors that goes above and beyond to ensure the success of his students. He was so helpful and genuine in office hours, made sure his students were well prepared for his exams and quizzes, and related all material to the real world. Would absolutely take a course from him again!
Nice class, not very difficult - accessible outside of class and will work with you. Extremely knowledgeable.

Trading and markets was a fun and easy class, she lectures and teacher well. She is super sweet and kind and always has a smile on her face. Class material was easy, I promise if you show up majority of the time you will get an easy A in this class. Most of the stuff is participation and the quizzes and final exam weren't hard at all.

Among the best Professors in Fisher!! She did so much in her field, very knowledgeable, is a part of multiple prestigious organizations yet still genuinely makes time for her students. Really down to earth and explains concepts super clearly. She makes us excited yet chill in trading simulations- "buy low sell high!" and wears her nasdaq sweater.

Ingrid's background is surprising considering how approachable she is. Very accomplished. She is also never in a bad mood. Also, about 50% of this class is spent basically playing a fun computer game simulating trading. Try and pick your group members for the various HWs and projects well in advance.
Shes Awesome! Loved the course.. and very helpful and friendly

Sheridan comes off scary asl when class starts but he grades easy and this exam are extremely fair if you come to class literally just study the slides and know it well. He grades the projects easy again just put in the time. Thought this class would be way harder than it is and he's a great lecturer. Hardest class to get into for a reason.
The best professor I've had at Fisher.  Lectures are great, and he is extremely knowledgeable and experienced

Professor Sheridan was awesome to learn from. He may not be for everyone but I learned more from him that in my entire time at OSU. He made me feel that I was spending money for his class that was actually worth it. The exams will be impossible if you don't go to class, I found myself wanting to go to class which is rare as I am a serial-skipper.

Professor Sheridan does a great job applying what was learned in the Intro to Investments class (Investments 4221) to the real world.  His lectures are very informative and even entertaining.  I have enjoyed this class more than any other course at OSU.  If you are passionate about investing, this class is for you!

Bad and mean person, thought himself smartest person in the world only because the experience of working in Wall Street before. He act like you are supposed to know everything and never talk more about anything. If you want kindness, dont choose him. He will let u know what is pride and prejudice.
Very Charismatic and great.

Professor Sheridan is such a great professor. He has taught me things that will literally change my life. Exams are fair and quizzes are easy. The investor policy statement was one of the most beneficial projects for my own personal investing future. On top of this he is a great lecturer. So glad I took this class!

Easily the best professor I have had at Ohio State. He makes the material fun, and by his delivery and engagement you will get so much more from the class. Easy grader on projects if everything is completed correctly. Exams can be difficult, but if you attend class should be easy to get by without much studying.
He is passionate but his class is sometimes confusing.. easily grade projects but hard exam.

He is the best professor I had in my time at OSU and Fisher specifically. His class is fun to go to and you will learn more about the real world and what is going on, than any other class you take here, I guarantee it. Go to class, not because he cares if you are there, but because you will learn so much. He is the man
Not a nice guy or a good person. Knows finance though..

Investment Strategies was an amazing class! The class ended up being curve about 1-2% which brought me to an A. There are a few quizzes that are easy, 2 projects which he grades pretty easily, then a midterm & final. Sheridan is passionate about the markets and this was my favorite class in Fisher!

Good guy and definitely knows his stuff about the financial markets. Can get a little political at times which takes away from the class since it has pretty much nothing to do with investment strategies but his crazy amount of knowledge outweighs any negative.

Prof Sheridan has been my favorite Professor not only in Fisher but at OSU in general. If you are interested in asset management or investing in general, Sheridan does a phenomenal job of doing market updates during class and setting you up for success as an investor. He is also hilarious and has quoted Jack Harlow a few times. Highly recommend.

TAKE THIS CLASS. This was my favorite finance elective by far, and I really think that I learned how to invest for myself and my future. This was the most useful class I took in four years. Sheridan is so funny and I really loved his daily market updates. Take this if you want to learn something! And go to class! Exams are pretty tough tho

I learned more in this class about investment finance and personal finances, than my other three years of undergrad. Exams are easy, projects are not bad as long as you have a full group. The class is focused solely on whats going on in the markets, so as long you show up everyday its an easy A-. Hes not very nice or flexible, but teaches well.

This was my favorite class at OSU by far. Sheridan was kind, helpful, and incredibly knowledgeable about finance/markets. This being said, the class consists of challenging material, projects, and exams (choose groups wisely). For those interested in asset management / IB, you will greatly benefit from this course. It landed me a great job!

Took his personal finance class for non-finance majors, and the fact that this isn't required is crazy. He gave us 2 pop quizzes (on carmen, but he told us about them in lecture and you had the whole weekend to complete them) for 10 points each, while the three homework assignments were 100 points each!! Lowest exam grade dropped. Highly recommend.

Matt is a great professor whose passion for finance is deep-seated.  Class lectures aim to help you understand how current events and the macro-economy affect the marketplace.  This class is going to be hard for you if you are more comfortable reading textbooks versus going to lectures  a good amount of testable material comes from lectures.

Very good lecturer. Knows the material well and imparts that knowledge well. Gives fair exams which were a little challenging, but all multiple choice with a focus on terminology. Entertaining lecturer too, always seems prepared to keep the audience engaged.  Overall, very good professor.

Matt was an outstanding professor. He really knows the material and delivers it enthusiastically and understandably. Brings in current news regarding the commercial real estate industry. This class gets you Argus certified, a gold standard DCF software for the RE industry. Must show up and go through case studies to do well. Not a gimme grade.
The Urban Meyer of teaching

Sheridan was the man. Fun lectures, learned a lot, and he is wicked smart. He trys to make complext topics interesting. It's a hard class if you can't attend all the time. I felt behind if I just missed one class. He covers about 13 chpaters in the text and adds a ton more material. Also requires WSJ. Tests are hard.

If you can take a class with Matt DO IT, and then fail so you can do it again -- he's that good.  Matt makes class fun, teaches you what you didn't know you needed to know, and makes finance better than it is. Hands down one of the best at Fisher. Do it.

Very good professor. Ties current events to classroom material 100% of time; 85% of the class is going to be over current events. Great resource for the industry and very easy to talk to after class or in office hours.

Investments 4221 taught by Professor Sheridan was the best class I have taken at Fisher. The class is taught 85% on current market events and 15% from the book. This I thought made the class very interesting especially when he correlated market events with his past career experiences of working with some of the top fund managers in the world.
Phenomenal professor, best I have ever had. Would take again.

Matt is an excellent professor and very engaged in teaching. Argus is a very useful tool for a career in Real Estate, and he always used current news and events, which made the class even more interesting and helpful. I totally recommend this class!

Matt is the best professor you can have in this field. He is extremely helpful, and he incorporated related news into the lecture, which I think was really a great thing. Strongly recommend this class!

Matt was an awesome professor for just starting at OSU. Real life stories applying to the finance world, going through the Wall Street Journal talking about recent events, and the course material all made for a great class and a lot to learn. Awesome guy.

Matt is one of my favorite professors in Fisher. He's a typical wall street guy, charming, humorous, and professional.  He's teaching style is different from most of Fisher faculties, probably because he has working experience in Bloomberg, NYC. Wall Street Journal is a must for the course. Getting an A is easy as long as you come to class.

One of my favorite instructors at OSU. Unlike other finance classes it wasn't overshadowed by assumption-laden theory, but instead was much more practical. Matt's industry experience was evident in every class. If you go to class, pay attention, and ask questions, you can't help but learn a ton about financial markets and current market events.

If you really want to learn reality finance, you can not miss Matt! He reads and explains news from WSJ and Financial Times every beginning of class. He also uses Bloomberg software to explain lecture content. Taking Matt's class= fun + learn a lot+good grade ( if you pay attention to class).

Matt likes to read us the hottest financial news thru Financial Times, New York Times and Wall Street, which are really helpful as we can approach the real financial world. This is also demonstrated in our exam. He is also a funny guy and you can learn a lot and have fun in classes. Taking his classes is a definitely good and smart choice !

Boys and girls!!!! If you are interest in real finance world, Matt is the guy can help you. His class is THE BEST in OSU. His class is easy, funny, interesting, real and most important things is give you a real view of finance. For example, he will try to read all important news on the class, from my working experience i know how important it is ?
Pretty down to earth prof. He's very helpful and his classes are actually enjoyable. He uses current events to explain things and his exams are no too bad. It was def worth taking his class
Bro has 24 5-stars for a reason.
Amazing Professor, would recommend him to anyone who can take him. Very knowledgeable and funny guy. Made me want to come to class. Going to take him again for his higher level course.

What everyone says is true, Salopek is an amazing professor. His lectures is extremely interesting and everything he teaches is relevant. Attendance is mandatory but it's such a good class you'll want to be there anyways. Quizzes and exams aren't hard, just study what he says and you'll be fine
Amazing professor! Makes the class so easy and enjoyable, very minimal studying involved. If you have to take Investments, take Salopek. You won't regret it! Best professor in Fisher

Steve Salopek is the best professor in Fisher! I had him in AU 22 for investments and it was my favorite business class I've ever taken. His lectures are engaging and it is easy to pay attention and follow along. He worked in the industry for years and has incredible stories from Wall Street. The exams and quizzes are very fair. He is hilarious!

Steven is one of the best professors at fisher hands down! he is super knowledgeable and engaging and cares about his students succeeding. easy to get an A/A- by giving effort into assignments. so good almost made me switch from corporate finance to investments!! TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!! you wont regret it!
Great teacher.
A really cool dude

Professor Salopek was awesome especially for someone like myself who came into his class knowing very little about investments. He has great real world experience that he ties into the material to make it interesting and tests and quizzes are really fair and straight forward. Would highly encourage people to take his class if they can!!

Best professor I had in Fisher. Most I've learned from a course and with little stress or effort. Incredible lectures. Minimal homework. Unbelievable industry knowledge. Cares for his students. Funny guy.

One of the best Fisher professors. This class was the easiest A I've received in my college career because he is such a great lecturer. His career is super interesting and definitely knows what he's talking about, but still really cares about his students. Take this class!

Take his class. Cool guy and knows his stuff. Actually wants you to learn that's why its on the easy side because he doesn't try to test you on things he doesn't teach you. He teaches you learn you do good. Wish more classes were like this. I would take this even if it wasn't required for my major.

Steve legit changed my life. You WILL get out what you put in. I showed interest in him and the material from day 1 and Steve was able to put me in contact with somebody at JP Morgan which ultimately led to me accepting an offer at JPM. Moral of the story is Steve is a legend and is genuinely interested in his student's success and will help!

I wish he taught every class at Fisher. The best Professor to take. Caring, respected and wants you to learn about the financial markets. Show up on time, stay engaged, ask questions and review his PPT slides. Guaranteed A
Best professor, by far, I've ever had in my life. He worked on Wall Street for over 20 years of his life, and knows Investing like the back of his hand. He will change your life, no joke.

Professor Salopek is by far my favorite professor in fisher. He cares about his students and is available both in and outside of office hours. His lectures are great as all of the important information is on the powerpoints making it easier to study but he brings in fun examples from his wall street experience to make lectures engaging.

This is the best class I have ever taken. He teaches the required material by connecting it to relevant current events. The lectures are always engaging and are never boring. Every assignment is extremely relevant to a career in Investments and is an opportunity to really learn something. Exams are straightforward and quizzes are open note/book.

GOAT. He is probably one of the best professors that I have taken at Fisher. His wall street experience is great and is really straightforward. There are no tricks in his midterms or quizzes. All the other fisher teachers can learn how to teach from this man.

Steven Salopek is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. I learned more in this class than I have in any other here. He is reasonable, informative, and understanding. You need to be in class to get the necessary information, but he makes you enjoy being in class so this isn't really an issue. He is extremely fair with grading & testing

Professor Salopek is by far one of the greatest professor's I've ever had. His knowledge of Wall Street is incredible and he puts great effort into making his classes interesting and useful. His class is a breeze if you pay attention during class, and it's honestly hard not to listen to him talk. He's a brilliant guy and an awesome teacher.

Steve is the best professor I have had in Fisher. He is very straight forward and always ties his lecture content to current events, making it easier to grasp. He is very funny and lets you take quizzes with open notes.

Salopek makes this course wonderful by bringing great people who have interesting experience in their careers. Weekly assignments but they don't take more than 1 hour each week. Cares about us and gets to know every student. Salopek also allows students that complete the course access to future speakers. Would definitely recommend!

Professor Salopek was truly an inspirational professor. He cares about his students and his passion for teaching is shown in his lectures and stories. Quizzes are open notes and exams are fair (he doesn't try to trick you on problems). Lectures can sometimes be dry and straight off the powerpoint, but I would take Salopek again in a heartbeat!

Best teacher I have taken at Fisher in 4 years. Professor Salopek had the most interesting lectures and every student was engaged. Very personable in office hours and is always open to any questions, even outside of the topic of investments. Really brings his 25+ years of wall street experience to the classroom. Would take this professor 100%.

He worked in Wall Street for over 20 years. The class is strongly related to outside world. Not only taught knowledge but also skills needed for jobs. Quizzes are open books and midterm is fair. Take him if you could. Suggest him to anyone

You have to do so much work for this class especially if you get cold called later in the semester because you gotta be ready to really explain what she asks for. This is BY FAR THE EASIEST ADVANCE FINANCE COURSE by it lowkey hella work. She is lowkey unclear on what she grades on but grades pretty fair. YOU MUST GO TO CLASS AND PARTICIPATE!

Absolutely loved her, shes so nice and gives interesting lectures. Theres a lot of reading and prep work for class, she cold calls everyone just once throughout the whole semester, and takes attendance & participation every class. 3 individual assignments and a big group project at the end. Shes a very lenient grader though and easy to talk to.
Not taught like a typical class.  Participation and attendance is mandatory.  Must be prepared for cold calls for credit.

Assignments are very on your own and unclear. Lectures are okay if you can be comfortable with being cold called on. She is friendly in lecture, but save yourself if you ever have a question on a case assignment. Grades are very few and tough, so it's hard to really get a great grade.

There were cases before class and discussions in class. Three assignments, a final project, and group simulation were the only assignments. Topics were interesting and she is passionate about the content. My advice to students would be to attend every class and seek one-on-one help to get the necessary feedback that isn't given automatically.

Professor Papadakis has a great class setup. Three assignments, simulation, presentation, and rest is participation. She will cold call on you at least once, but it is easy to earn participation credit. Just read the cases prior to class and attend class regularly and you will get an A. Seems like she's asking for a lot, but it is easy to do well.

KP is an extremely knowledgeable professor & is always willing to help/answer questions about HW & case studies. Attendance and cold calling is graded. Its easy to get an A if you regularly attend class and follow along with the case studies. Not attending will leave you feeling behind and lost. I would definitely take again, I learned a lot.

Great instructor. Class is tough but she grades very fairly and is very willing to work with students outside the classroom. Participation matters and she takes into account effort given in class. Would take again

Loved Kennia. Her lectures are fun and interesting. Just show up to class, do the assignments and you'll get an A. She is so nice to meet with and is genuinely interested in helping people. I learned a lot from this class.

Many individual homework assignments, with one group project at the end. Participation is important to her, but it honestly doesn't take much to get a decent grade. Don't be worried if you're lost--most students are. Just try your best and be sure to communicate if you're having trouble. No exams makes this class a lot less stressful than others.
Loved KP! She's very personable and understanding. She is definitely a tough grader, but I feel like I got a lot out of her class that I'll use into my career. Highly recommend!

Good class and professor. Grades consist of 3 case assignments and participation on weekly discussions on cases. She will cold call on you a few times over the semester. Fairly relaxed grader on the case assignments. Probably spend 12 hours per graded case. She can seem tough on some questions she asks or responses. Most cases are interesting

I had a tough time in this class. And I am a straight-A student. She expects students to know everything and expects us to solve the cases before class when she hasn't even taught anything! She wants everyone to participate and makes it a significant portion of the grade. I only took it because she was the only one. Else, HARD PASS on her classes.

Read 14 cases (1 per week). show up and contribute to the class discussion and you will earn your 20% participation grade. Submit 4 excel files based on 4 selected cases (more about interpreting data than the actual numbers); this makes up other 80%. My favorite class at Fisher, hands down

She knows her stuff when it comes to corporate finance, she has the education and experience to back it up too. You are graded by only five things with one being participation but she is not a tough grader at all. Participation is a key part of the class so come prepared and you'll be fine. Overall I usually looked forward going to class.

Participation is 20% of the grade. She often cold-calls, so it is important to prepare before classes. Tough grader on the homework assignments and doesn't give feedback. Very tough to do well unless you participate; showing up to class but not speaking doesn't give you any points. All case-based (weekly case discussions and 5 case homeworks).

Kennia knows the material well and is funny in class.  Participation is important, as it is a large part of your grade.  She gives good feedback on your projects, and isn't too tough of a grader.  I would recommend taking her class.

It doesn't seem like you learn much in this class.  Changes the policy of grading throughout the semester, not consistent, and not organized.  PPT slides are not helpful, in order to learn or to complete the assignment  one needs to google everything.

If you want an easy class this isn't for you. Bodine basically explains every field & thing in finance in this class so there is A LOT of material. The exams are fair just study the slides and don't overthink. You NEED to go to class and he will make fun of everyone but it makes the class more personal. Very funny, very informative, a little hard

The Goat. Learned more from him than any other professor at OSU. Show up to class and you'll be fine. Discussion-based class where he gets everyone to participate and relates the class to real-world news. Some say he's intimidating but stick it out and I promise his class is worth it. Would take this class every semester of college if I could.

The guy thinks that he's God. Will insult you in front of the class if you don't answer one of his questions correctly. Most of what he says needs to be fact checked. Very opinionated and tries to force his opinions on his students. Makes inappropriate and racist comments regularly.

One of my favorite professors I've ever had. Everyone seems to love or hate him, that's just his personality. You will never get to experience a class with such a guy. He is as "real world" as someone can get. He will tell you how it is. Perhaps the most successful and experienced professor in Fisher. I would take his class again in an instant.

Great teacher, not a great professor. All materials are on a different canvas website which makes it difficult. Says no dumb questions then berates people for asking dumb questions. Learned a ton from the class, but if you are looking for a stress free grade this is not the class for you.

Prof. Bodine can be intimidating at first, but if you do what he says and show up to lecture, you will learn a ton. I got more out of his classes than any other course I took at Ohio State. Exams are challenging, but if you study they are very fair. Ultimately, you get out of it what you put in.
HORRIBLE!!! AVOID!!! You would be stupid to take this class with him.

Birru is a great professor and his lectures are engaging. He is really humbled and willing to help students to solve their questions. The exam was not easy, but as long as you attend to the lectures, it's gonna be ok.

Very nice and humble guy. Lectures are engaging and encourages students to ask and answer questions; flows almost like a story so it's easy to recall during the exam. 3 homework assignments and a final exam which wasn't too bad.

The final is not easy (multiple choice & a few short answer) & it is worth 45% of your grade. The is mostly about the efficient market hypothesis not individuals investors behaviors. Birru is super kind though and a great professor.
Great professor! Really a nice person to talk with.

The class is 3 homework assignments and a final exam worth 55% of your grade. The homework is not difficult and does not take very long. The final covers all material and is tough to study for because its the first time you see how he formats tests. Overall, the exam was not overly difficult if you took the time to go through all of the slides.
Do. Not. Take. This. Class. With. Her. Save yourself before you can't

She was very difficult to understand, however, I do giver her credit because she did seem to care a little bit about her students. However, every time someone got a questions wrong, instead of explaining why it was wrong, she just said it was wrong and moved on. I don't think I learned anything at the end of her class.

She gives a lot of busy type work and lectures are truly boring and awful. I struggled to stay awake during class and was bored out of my mind as she made fairly simple material way more complicated than it actually was. Basically have to teach the material to yourself because she is useless. Plus you have to buy a huge book

This class was so unorganized, the whole class is based on the textbooks and the online lectures are worthless. The homework is impossible to do well on and the quizzes have questions that are not covered in anywhere in the book or in class. Completely unfair class but the graded problems sets are with a lot of points and are easy.
It's an interesting finance course.

He is a great teacher that loves what is teaching about. The class is made for people that like the FinTech world before hand, but you are going to learn a lot. Prepare yourself to read and talk. If you attend class, you will enjoy but it is not the easiest class.
Taner is a fine lecturer for such a big class. Exams were very straightforward with questions pulled straight from the study guide. Nothing to complain about, really.

Horrible. Never helps when students have a question and refuses to meet over zoom so you have to trek to the business campus if you have a question that could be an email. Has never answered my questions and just redirects me to figure it out.

This professor was the least accommodating, most un professional professor Ive ever had. He ignored what he stated in the syllabus, then claimed he was following the syllabus. He forgot to release assignment due dates and people were given zeros. If you were kicked out of proctorio exams were not allowed extra time, and he said it was your fault.

The worst teacher I have ever met. The course was basically fully automated and the instructional videos were not even recorded by him. Not actively helping or even ignoring the questions and difficulties raised by the students, which is very disappointing to me.

I had already taken an interest theory class, so this one was about 90% review for me. As a result, I dont have much to say about Prof. Pirim. He seemed nice enough. There was weekly homework from the online textbook which could be lengthy. Exams very closely mimic the practice exams and werent too difficult.

Our lectures were recorded by someone else, our exam was multiple choice graded by carmen and his practice problem videos were 2+ years old. He didnt do anything this semester. I asked him what something meant and he said Im not really sure. His class is manageable if you put a lot of time in it, but I did not enjoy it. Do the study guide tho!

Took his course Spring semester and I can feel he is quite careless as the lecture recording was made by someone else and material came from Person( which is a really disgusting website, freak out quite often). Many exercises provided by him were full of small typos and vague points. He use proctorio for exam and it's a poor designed system.
He spent a lot of time outside of class to teach us... He is very enthusiastic and FAIR to his students...
Great guy period!

I didn't understand his lectures. Disorganized & poorly communicated. Powerpoints were useless. Wrote on chalkboard but illegible. Also blew through material quickly. Biggest problem for me was exams. 2/3 comes from study guide, but they were LONG. About 38 math questions for 55 minutes. I got 80% on exams. Aced final solely bc I had more time.

Second time I have taken a class with Dr. Pirim. First was FIN 3120. This one was much easier and way more enjoyable. Definitely recommend taking it. He really wants you to learn and see you succeed both in his class and in the future.

He really is a great professor and teacher. He is full of energy and humor. His classes are NEVER BORING. He has very wide knowledge of what is going on in real world as he worked many years for big companies and has a strong background in business and engineering. He is really cool and unique in his own way. He truly cares about his students.

Exams are easy, material is low key hard. Study guides are a must to do well. As a person, he's not great. He isn't flexible about your schedule whatsoever (I missed an important religious event because he refused to move my exam earlier by a couple hours). Lectures are useless if you watch the videos.
Be prepared for the last statement of the courses.

Read the textbook and go to class. I did both and I still struggled a lot in this class. He may be hard to reach outside of office hours but he will definitely do the best he can to help you when you are there. Hard material and doesn't cover everything that is tested on during class but a study guide is given which helps a lot.
Graded solely on midterm and final exams. However, study guide is provided for each exam. 2/3 of questions on exam are pulled from study guide.

I'm Actuarial Science major, so lots of he stuff is already learned in Math 3618; I only look at the slides and practice tests to study for exams, which are made of exact same questions and questions you can get insights from studying practice questions. He's very hilarious and caring, but I stopped going to class...

Best business class I've ever taken. He explains everything perfectly and repeats problems, which some people will find annoying however I found it very helpful and didn't mind. Great guy and you will learn a lot.

He makes it really easy to do well in this class. 2/3 of the questions on the exams come word for word from the study guide, and you are given the answers. A lot of the questions are just plug-and-chug on the calculator and you are given a formula sheet. A financial calculator is a huge help on the tests.

I dropped this course halfway through the semester and decided to take a parallel course at a different university while I was doing a full-time internship back home. I cannot stres how much better that course was and I am thankful everyday that OSU approved it as credit for the course. This is not easy subject matter, made more difficult by Pirim.

Great teacher. Unlike many other professors, this guy seems almost like a real person, he tries to connect with the students through humor and is funny. There are 3 midterms and a final (33% of final grade) and that's your final grade- No homework. Pay attention in class, and get the book. READ THE BOOK! 70% of test questions come from study guide.

EXTREMELY condescending and rude in office hours. I went in with questions about the powerpoint slides, and he basically told me I was studying wrong and had to buy the book, which ended up being the exact same as what was on the slides. Awfully unorganized class structure with an unhelpful prof. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM IF YOU CAN AVOID IT!!!
Really nice professor!

He is a really funny guy and wants you to understand finance. He doesn't treat the class as some formula sheet to a test but will make sure that you understand real world finance. I visited him in his office hours and each time helped incredibly.

He cares if you understand the material and goes over stuff really slow to make sure you do. He has an enjoyable personally so class is not bad. Gives you a helpful study guide with 2/3 test questions on it, but some questions on the test can be a little tricky if you haven't seen them before. Make sure you use your book and quizlet for tests!

Taner is extremely smart (look up his degrees & past experience) and knows how to effectively communicate concepts/how to crunch numbers. His lectures are pretty much from the slides and he shows easy & practical methods how to break down & solve problems. He's willing to help when asked, cares about how you do, and is the best professor I've had.
There is a lot on the exam that is straight from the book that is not covered in class. He is very helpful if you go into office hours though.

You have two paths  Path 1: Dont go to class and memorize his study guide for each exam since about 70% of the study guide is on the exam (literally copies and pastes the questions). If you do this, you will receive a C.  Path 2: Go to class, enjoy his lectures, and learn the material... and still memorize the study guide for safe measures.
This is a tough class but Dr. Pirim is a great teacher. It is important to go to class, I would recommend this prof. he really cares about his students.
He is really good. He knows what he is talking about and has industry experience which is a super plus!...
Do the practice tests posted on Carmen. 75% of the tests are from the practice tests. They also help you study for the 25% of the questions that are not on the practice test.
Alessandro is a really nice professor, recommend taking his class

He's definitely one of my favorite professors. The way he explains the material makes it easy to understand, and you can tell he's really passionate and knowledgeable about finance. With his strong academic background and real-world experience in the finance industry, he gave insights that go beyond just career advice—life skills like meditation.

Very great professor which is pretty cool considering it was only his first year I think. He also gave us a list of his favorite investment-related books which I thought was pretty cool. Grade consists of like 6 open note quizzes, group presentation, 2 guest speakers, and a final. Only downside is sometimes hard to hear through the Italian accent.

This class is pretty straightforward if you watch the videos he provides. Course consists of a few Excel assignments, a couple discussion questions, and six quizzes, including the final "comprehensive quiz." He drops one quiz including the final, so if you do well on the first five, you don't even have to worry about taking it.
The class is very easy if you just watch the lectures. He teaches everything clearly and gives you important skills that you might use in the real world.

Class is quick, if you've taken CSE 2111 or worked in Excel at an internship the class is a breeze. Finished the course within a week of starting it barring the final. Instructional videos are extremely grainy. Doesn't answer emails on-time though, pointed out a clear mistake in a quiz and he refused to regrade unless others got it wrong.

He pronounces Finance like Finnance. Other than that, he is a good prof. This class will give you whiplash though. The first week of class we basically had a midterm, but the class got easier as it went on. You will get a good grade if you put in effort and ask questions. Funny guy.

The instruction quality is awful. I've been going to college since 2012 and I can say, with the utmost confidence that he is not it when it comes to lecturing. He needs to stick to accounting and leave TEACHING to the professionals. Despite providing terrible lectures, he is very knowledgeable.

The course was profoundly disorganized and the quality of instruction was awful. Little effort made to maintain order or facilitate a conducive learning atmosphere. Very difficult quizzes that seemed misaligned with the poorly delivered lecture content. Material that was either not covered or hastily brushed over during class sessions.

This is an online class. His teaching materials are very outdated. Many of the websites he provides cannot be opened. There is a lot of material and the location of them is very confusing and messy. You will spend several times more time looking for it than the video. The first quiz is difficult.

Took his financial data class and short selling class (BusFin 4237) and is one of the best professors at Ohio State. If you're interested in equity research and valuation short selling with Tod Schneider is extremely valuable and I can't recommend it enough.

Professor Schneider clearly knows a LOT about what he is talking about, and has a lot of industry experience that really helps to contextualize the things you learn. You mostly learn practical excel skills that are used in beginning analyst roles.
He was a good teacher that explained things clearly. Although there were a few challenging/confusing assignments, he would answer all questions to clear things up.

Professor Schneider did a great job at setting up this course. The course is built as a more advanced excel course and is really beneficial if you will be working with excel extensively in the future. The class consists of a few quizzes, homework assignments and a final quiz at the end that's optional if you did well enough on the other quizzes.

Very easy class. I spent maybe 2 hours for every quiz watching the lecture vids, doing the practice, and then taking the quiz. The final exam was short, but managed to cover all the topics we learned. Highly recommend if you need an easy A, and like asynchronous classes. His videos are literally tutorials for how to do the quiz. Mostly use excel.

Class should not be as difficult as it is. You end up having to teach self majority of information, specifically in the last unit and quiz, because it is not well explained as no live lectures and YouTube videos. Frustrating and Tedious.
A 1.5 credit class with too much workload. He gives awful video demonstrations that don't line up with any of the actual assignments. Super unorganized. Quizzes are hard for no reason.
Class is very easy and you know what is expected. Basically just an advanced Excel course.
Very easy class. He explains each module very well, which is rare for an online class. He's great!!

Its a 7 week class over financial websites & excel so every Sunday theres usually 2-3 assignments to do. Over one topic there will be an assignment, quiz, and discussion question. His video modules show you exactly what you need to know for the assignments. He drops the lowest quiz grade so you can skip the final if you did good on other quizzes.

7-week online course so starts off strong or else it will be hard to recover. Grades pretty much 50% completion and 50% quizzes so complete all the assignments and you're looking good. Dont wait until the last minute on Sunday since some of the assignments are lengthy.

This is one of the more helpful classes I've taken so far. Great information and skills that can be applied to a career in Financial Services are learned in the class. The only problem I had was the inability to review your past quizzes. You never know what you got right or wrong and it is hard to correct your mistakes for the cumulative final quiz

Tod is fine, not great. Completely online class and the video modules can be unclear and sometimes more complex than needed. The software used to monitor cheating, Proctorio, is a pain. I reccomend taking detailed notes over the videos and do the optional practice files and save them, as they often show up on quizzes. Wish hed post solutions.

Professor Schneider is a brilliant resource for finance however his lectures are very technical. Since he is very smart, he uses complex technical jargon and I think he forgets that he needs to dumb things down for students; so, his lectures are hard to understand. He is hysterical though, and a great person overall.
Tod is a great professor is who more than willing to go the extra mile to help students to understand topics.

Yet another example of someone who has no business teaching. He spent years in the financial industry and decided to come back and do what he calls teaching. The material its self is simple excel basics that everyone should know by now. Every quiz would have typos and errors, he needs to learn how to administer a course.

Schneider doesn't know how to administer a course. Quizzes & assignments constantly have errors. Assignments can be misleading and some I didn't learn anything. Can't seen to have consistent office hours. Regardless, he is nice & hilarious to talk with in-person.

He is definitely passionate about teaching. Your grade is mostly based on 6 quizzes and two exams, which are tough but open book. Exams are heavily based on lecture slides and practice problems, however there seemed to be times where he asked questions based on things he hadn't gone over, especially in the latter half of the course.

I think Professor Schiller is very passionate about teaching and his class is generally fair. This is a higher level course so it is hard and you need to do the optional practice problems to do well. I liked him as a teacher but the course is hard so that's where some of the hate comes from. Recommend putting everything into excel after learning
Awful lecturer who made common mistakes in every class. I did not learn a single thing in this class, I would avoid at all costs.

He has an accent but the slides are laid out nicely. You're allowed to use the slides during quizzes which makes them easy. He is very knowledgable and I looked forward to going to class. Only problem is the final is weighted very heavily and can completely change your grade.

Might be the worst professor I've ever had. Don't learn anything during lectures and doesn't go over any problems so you pretty much have to teach yourself. Exams are 10x more difficult than the homeworks with questions that weren't even on the homework. I've had TA's teach a class similar to this and were 100% better than this professor.
Terrible professor. Didn't provide adequate info for exams.
professor shaffer genuinely cares about the success of her students and gets to know you as an individual
She knows nothing about what to teach. Awful experience!

Investments is a class with so many options of instructors, definitely you should avoid Sharon. Her lectures perfectly avoid her course materials and she has more homewroks than any of other instructors. Her exam are very difficult and does not provide extra credit. If your goal is E, what can be wrong choosing Sharon?

If you're not interested in cryptocurrency/machine learning you will be bored out of your mind. But if you do like that stuff, his lectures are very interesting and you can tell he's really passionate about what he talks about. Easy grader and a very nice guy. Despite how easy the class was, I feel like I learned a lot from him.
He was such a nice and brilliant guy. Very interesting discussion on bitcoin, blockchain, and machine learning. He is hot!
Nice professor but makes you want to fall asleep in class, lectures are kind of boring.
He is such a nice professor. Very easy and interesting class. Easy grader. 4 assignments and one final.
Exams are difficult, 0 curve  and worksheets are beyond hard.

Often times you have professors that are so out of touch with how the real world works but Steve is not that guy. He teaches a tough class, but I have never learned so much as I did in his class. He's also a great resource to connect you with job opportunities. Overall it's a great class if you're genuinely interested in real estate investing.
Pretty easy course to take if you study. Awesome and astute professor who cares about his students. Definitely take this course.
Stephen is a nice guy, but his exams are very difficult! you are expected to know 250+ concepts in depth per test. lectures can get boring, and attendance is mandatory.

Professor Stuckwisch can tend to get a bad rep based on the difficulty of the class, but he teaches real estate finance, a tough subject, as best he can. 

Incredibly experienced in the field, he was able to provide me & my classmates with career guidance and he teaches his class to actually be relevant to working in the world of real estate
His classes are so boring and he covers information on his exams that he just simply doesn't go over in class. Does not present any information clearly and just plainly sucks.
His lectures are so boring but he is a pretty nice guy.

Professor Stuckwisch is a real estate geek in the best way possible. His lectures can be dry sometimes, but if you are passionate about learning more about CRE, definitely take his class. You can tell he cares about his students and will take the time to answer any questions and make sure they are understood.
The average for the first midterm was a D-. He has a hard time presenting the material, and setting up students for success.
Terrible at explaining content. Do not recommend.

This was, quite simply, a boring class. Real estate is not all its hopped up to be. He's a total wonk who geeks out on this stuff so hard, if you don't live and breathe this stuff, it can be unbearable.

Stephen is an awesome teacher who is really passionate about the real estate industry. He brings in a ton of speakers to talk about their different jobs in real estate. If you have the opportunity, take this class!
Just ace your exams and you'll be good just know all the slides and pay attention for quizzes

Doesn't think you're worth his time. Don't even try to schedule office hours with him because he will brush you off. Ran into him in Fisher and he's rude in person as well. This is an easy class but I would not take another class with him if I had the choice.

This class is an asynchronous course, 90% of your work has to be done at home by watching hours of videos each week. When you have difficulties, the teacher seems to be exhausted by your questions. Would definitely not take this class again.
Best professor I have ever had! I learned so much and my respect levels are off the charts for this man. Gives a lot of real life examples from his past experience. Chad is almost HIM
Online asynchronous class with in person final makes no sense. Doesn't prepare students for final at all
Exams and quizzes were pretty difficult.
Professor Zipfel is the best professor for corporate finance! You will learn a lot from him. He is very accessible outside class and really cares for his students.

Professor Zipfel does a great job with this class. It has the perfect amount of work for a 1.5 credit hour class. It consisted of quizzes, weekly discussions and homework assignments, and a final at the end of the course. The professor had a lot on his plate, but was still willing to help. He definitely knows how to setup this course for success.
Chad makes the class easy and straightforward.

He is easily the best teacher for Corporate and tries to make the material interesting and gets to know everyone in the class. The toughest part of the class is having online lectures from other teachers who do not explain the content as well as Chad.
Chad is a good professor but feels like he makes his tests unnecessarily hard. Would still recommend his though.
This class definitely isn't an easy A but Chad is very passionate and explains the material in an interesting and relevant way. Study hard for the exams or you're screwed.

Chad is a really great teacher who genuinely wants his students to succeed. He is extremely passionate about what he does and really goes above and beyond! Although, I will say, this course is very "sink or swim"(his words); weekly quizzes are timed, he doesn't hand out practice problems, and if you fall behind he doesn't wait for you to catch up.

Chad has been one of my favorite professors. He adds a lot of outside information and is genuinely interested in finance and teaching. Personality wise: terrific. Teaching wise, pretty good, you can get a lot from him. His answers to questions may be tough to understand though. He sometimes responds at a very high level. Would recommend.
Really cares for student success and provides everything needed to do well in the course

It is a easy class. All difficult concepts are from AP ECON and 4211(other knowledge is straight forward ). I recommend to take 4211 first and, then take this class in the next semester(can safe your time when understanding some concepts). Exams are all from PPT, so just remember as much as you can before the Exams and you will be good.

Even though he insisted he did not want to trick us, he put specific and wordy questions on his tests. His detailed economics that he teaches in the online lectures always show up on his tests. We get 60 minutes to complete 35 questions online for the final. It's a tough class.

He looks like a cool professor and cares about his students. BUT that's just on the surface!! When you need some actual help on your course work to improve your grade it seems as if there nothing he can do.

Zipfel is a great teacher that genuinely cares about his students inside and outside of the classroom. Whether it is taking a theoretical financial concept and connecting it to a current event or helping a student find an internship or get an interview he's awesome. To succeed in the class look through his power points and take notes &attend class

Seems inconvenienced when you go to his office hours, but then encourages it in class... it's a catch 22. He also makes students feel stupid in class; if you aren't confident in your answer, do NOT raise your hand... he will humiliate you. Cases are far too difficult for this level. He forgets who he is teaching and can be quite arrogant at times.

So here's the deal. Chad is a great lecturer. He loves to teach and is passionate about corporate finance. He tells people to go to office hours but then I feel like he doesn't want me there. Oh and good luck with the final case - impossible.

There was really no need in reading the book because all the material is on the powerpoint. I wasted too much time reading when I could have just watched the lectures and focused on what he spent time on. If you need an A, memorize the powerpoint slides.

He seems really passionate about what he is teaching and has a lot of real world experience he brings to lectures. Quizzes are hard and monitored (even online)!!! The online lectures do not prepare you well. Was extremely off-putting when I went to office hours, was very short and clearly did not want to spend the time helping me.

One of the best instructors who care for students. Take his class and you'll get real industry knowledge and experience. One thing to warn is that group projects are actually intensive and involved. You need to take time digesting some of the materials outside his class since he focuses more on sharing but not teaching math problems.
Professor Chad was wonderful while the class materials are hard in its nature. Chad would be a good choice for you as you need to take BUSFIN 3220 At Fisher
One of the best professors I've had that really cares about students success.

Semester started off a bit rocky, but overall a really good finance professor. Quizzes, Midterm, Final are all multiple choice and he gives you a pretty good study guide for each. Assigned a group at the beginning for a series of group projects. He is a nice guy with industry experience and is pretty good at what he does. Do not get the textbook.
First year teacher has great potential very smart and personable. Class is not difficult few group work assignments but overall solid teacher and class. Would recommend

Fairly easy class, midterm was easy. Truly cares about teaching/your grade and knows a lot about the subject. First time teaching the class, so has trouble explaining topics at times, but if you ask him to clarify he always does.
Good professor, still learning. He is a new professor so he is still learning the ropes. Mid term was easy, pay attention in class and read you should do fine.

this guy knows so much about corporate finance that he forgets that he is teaching a class full of students who dont know what he is talking about. this guy expects us to know everything before he even begins teaching. cool guy but cannot teach
This is his first semester teaching. He knows what he is talking about corporate finance-wise, but he expects his students to know more than the usual for finance. A lot of group work.
He is a nice guy but he can not teach.

BUSFIN 3300: Derik is an amazing Professor, I am in his class currently and have really been enjoying it. He is extremely knowledgeable, enthusiastic about teaching, and truly wants to see his students succeed. Derik has been the best Professor that I've had at OSU and I would love to get the opportunity to take another course with him.
BUSFIN 3300: He's a very nice professor, puts a lot of effort into his lectures, and wants the students to do well.  Would definitely recommend for Principles of Insurance.

He's very passionate about the subject and cares a lot about helping his students succeed. The content of the class is straightforward and easy to understand, and the assignments are pretty easy. I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes.

Derik Staufenberg is an amazing professor! He thoroughly explains concepts and really wants to help his students. I had him for principles of insurance and he was great! 100% would recommend taking his class.
I had my online recitation with him.  He was a nice guy who explained the problems well and was willing to help his students.
Super cool guy! Talks kind of like Owen Wilson. Cares about his students and wants them to get the most out of the course. Very helpful and accessible. Would thoroughly recommend.
Decent professor. Not bad but not good, helpful enough.
He does a decent job of breaking things down. He's not an out of this world professor but gets the job done.

Learned more from this class and Professor Wellman than any other course I've taken at OSU. He's genuinely a wonderful person and always willing to answer questions and help outside of class. Very reasonable quizzes and exams, all open note. By far the best professor to take Corporate Finance with.
Best professor at OSU. Genuinely wants you to do good and very kind. He's also very funny and his lectures are never boring.
One of the best professors at the university. He makes a hard subject like Finance very interesting. Learnt a lot in this class.
Professor Wellman is a great lecturer and if you pay attention in class and do enough studying you will do well on the exams.

This is probably the hardest class that I have taken at Fisher, but an A is still incredibly achievable. The class is graded on a curve (91 was an A), as the average for the midterm was in the 70s. With that being said, just do the end of chapter problems because those have a striking resemblance to most of the exam questions (he mentions this).

Professor Wellman is a funny guy and he does seem like he genuinely cares but his exams are absolutely ridiculous. The midterm and the final make up 40% of the grade and a lot of the people in my class didnt even finish the exam before time was up. Like I said, really nice guy but try to take the class with someone else.
Class is not easy. Go to lectures and office hours. Try to take another professor.

I actually really liked attending class because he was a really great conversationalist, and was easy to listen to! There really wasn't a bunch of homework but if you didn't do practice problems from the textbook, I don't think I would have passed. His exams were extremely hard and the class average for them was always in the 60's. Great person tho

This class was difficult for me because I didnt get the textbook and he assigns textbook problems to do for practice. This would have helped for the midterm and final. There were 5 graded homeworks, a market concepts thing that you do for completion, and a portfolio project you can do with a group if you choose.

Hardest course Ive taken at osu. I studied for two weeks for the final and thought I did well and ended up getting a 61, the average was a 66. He purposefully makes the exams so hard abs curved a little so my 77 ended up as a B but still. Terrible teacher, nice guy.

Really great guy who cares about your success. Has office hours, but offers his help through email 24/7. Easy online quizzes with a group project he helps a ton with and then two tests. Whole class curved up (A- to A, B+ to A- etc) but he really does care about his students and is super knowledgable.
